bug.author: willbattel
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêûDescribe the bug</denchmark-h>
Importing coremltools in the new 4.0b3 release causes a ModuleNotFoundError. <denchmark-h:h2>Trace</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>Traceback (most recent call last): File "main.py", line 1, in <module> import coremltools as ct File "env/lib/python3.7/site-packages/coremltools/__init__.py", line 54, in <module> from . import converters File "env/lib/python3.7/site-packages/coremltools/converters/__init__.py", line 7, in <module> from . import libsvm File "env/lib/python3.7/site-packages/coremltools/converters/libsvm/__init__.py", line 8, in <module> from . import _libsvm_converter File "env/lib/python3.7/site-packages/coremltools/converters/libsvm/_libsvm_converter.py", line 7, in <module> from ..._deps import _HAS_LIBSVM File "env/lib/python3.7/site-packages/coremltools/_deps/__init__.py", line 15, in <module> from packaging import version ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'packaging' </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
If a python script can reproduce the error, please paste the code snippet
<denchmark-code>virtualenv env source env/bin/activate pip install coremltools-4.0b3-cp37-none-macosx_10_15_intel.whl </denchmark-code>
In main.py: <denchmark-code>import coremltools as ct </denchmark-code>
The ModuleNotFoundError occurs when importing coremltools. <denchmark-h:h2>System environment (please complete the following information):</denchmark-h>
coremltools version (e.g., 3.0b5): 4.0b3 OS (e.g., MacOS, Linux): masOS macOS version (if applicable): 10.15.6 XCode version (if applicable): N/A How you install python (anaconda, virtualenv, system): virtualenv python version (e.g. 3.7): 3.7.5 any other relevant information: None
<denchmark-h:h2>Additional context</denchmark-h>
This problem does not happen with the 4.0b2 wheel, only the 4.0b3 wheel.

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/willbattel>@willbattel</denchmark-link> installing packaging module resolve this. We will add this as a dependency
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/srikris>@srikris</denchmark-link> Can you add module dependency to ? module is used in

@srikris Can you add packaging module dependency to setup.py? packaging module is used in
coremltools/coremltools/_deps/__init__.py
Line 15 in 9473763
from packaging import version
Will make sure to include this in next release, thanks!
what should I do before this gets fixed? Is there a manual way too add the dependancy of packaging as an work around. I am running 4.0b3 and would like to be able to import coremltools.

what should I do before this gets fixed? Is there a manual way too add the dependancy of packaging as an work around. I am running 4.0b3 and would like to be able to import coremltools.
You can install packaging yourself. For example, if using pip, simply pip install packaging.
This issue has been fixed and will include in the next release. Thanks!
